@314rated No, you aren't facing the same issue, as you, in contrast to the others you want to put the LSTM in eval mode, while the others want train mode.

Your options are a) leave the LSTM in training mode (but you could .requires_grad_(false) the parameters and not pass them to the optimizer) or b) not use cudnn (by wrapping the LSTM call in with torch.backends.cudnn.flags(enabled=False):).

As it's not related to the issue, it would be best if we could move further discussion to the forum.
